00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the PCI / PCIe DMA engines. These are only avialable
00044  * on chips with PCI / PCIe.
00045  *
00046  * <hr>$Revision: 121436 $<hr>
00047  */
00048 
00049 #ifndef __CVMX_DMA_ENGINES_H__
00050 #define __CVMX_DMA_ENGINES_H__
00051 
00052 #ifdef CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_KERNEL
00053 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-dpi-defs.h>
00054 #include <asm/octeon/cvmx-fpa.h>
00055 #else
00056 #include "cvmx-dpi-defs.h"
00057 #include "cvmx-fpa.h"
00058 #endif
00059 
00060 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00061 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00062 extern "C" {
00063 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00064 #endif
00065 
00066 typedef enum {
00067     CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_OUTBOUND = 0,
00068                         /**< OUTBOUND (read from L2/DRAM, write into PCI / PCIe memory space) */
00069     CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INBOUND = 1,
00070                         /**< INBOUND (read from PCI / PCIe memory space, write into L2/DRAM) */
00071     CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INTERNAL = 2,
00072                         /**< INTERNAL-ONLY (read from L2/DRAM, write into L2/DRAM). Only available on chips with PCIe */
00073     CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_EXTERNAL = 3,
00074                         /**< EXTERNAL-ONLY (read from PCIe memory space, write into PCIe memory space). Only available on chips with PCIe */
00075 } cvmx_dma_engine_transfer_t;
00076 
00077 typedef union {
00078     uint64_t u64;
00079     struct {
00080         uint64_t reserved_60_63:4;
00081                         /**< Must be zero */
00082         uint64_t fport:2;       /**< First port. FPort indicates the physical PCIe port used for the
00083                                                 PCIe memory space pointers in the FIRST POINTERS block in the
00084                                                 EXTERNAL-ONLY case. Must be zero in the OUTBOUND, INBOUND and
00085                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY cases. Must be zero on chips with PCI */
00086         uint64_t lport:2;       /**< Last port. LPort indicates the physical PCIe port used for the
00087                                                 PCIe memory space pointers in the LAST POINTERS block in the
00088                                                 OUTBOUND, INBOUND, and EXTERNAL-ONLY cases. Must be zero in the
00089                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY case. Must be zero on chips with PCI */
00090         cvmx_dma_engine_transfer_t type:2;
00091                           /**< Type � A given PCI DMA transfer is either OUTBOUND (read from L2/DRAM,
00092                                                 write into PCI / PCIe memory space), INBOUND (read from PCI / PCIe memory space, write
00093                                                 into L2/DRAM), INTERNAL-ONLY (read from L2/DRAM, write into L2/DRAM), or
00094                                                 EXTERNAL-ONLY (read from PCIe memory space, write into PCIe memory space). */
00095         uint64_t wqp:1;         /**< Work-queue pointer. When WQP = 1, PTR (if non-zero) is a pointer to a
00096                                                 work-queue entry that is submitted by the hardware after completing the DMA;
00097                                                 when WQP = 0, PTR (if non-zero) is a pointer to a byte in local memory that
00098                                                 is written to 0 by the hardware after completing the DMA. */
00099         uint64_t c:1;           /**< C � Counter. 1 = use counter 1, 0 = use counter 0.
00100                                                 The C bit selects between the two counters (NPEI_DMA_CNTS[DMA0,DMA1])
00101                                                 that can optionally be updated after an OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY
00102                                                 transfer, and also selects between the two forced-interrupt bits
00103                                                 (NPEI_INT_SUMn[DMA0_FI, DMA1_FI]) that can optionally be set after an
00104                                                 OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY transfer. C must be zero for INBOUND or
00105                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY transfers. */
00106         uint64_t ca:1;          /**< CA � Counter add.
00107                                                 When CA = 1, the hardware updates the selected counter after it completes the
00108                                                 PCI DMA OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY Instruction.
00109                                                     - If C = 0, PCIE_DMA_CNT0 is updated
00110                                                     - If C = 1, PCIE_DMA_CNT1 is updated.
00111                                                 Note that this update may indirectly cause
00112                                                 NPEI_INT_SUM[DCNT0,DCNT1,DTIME0,DTIME1] to become set (depending
00113                                                 on the NPEI_DMA*_INT_LEVEL settings), so may cause interrupts to occur on a
00114                                                 remote PCI host.
00115                                                     - If NPEI_DMA_CONTROL[O_ADD1] = 1, the counter is updated by 1.
00116                                                     - If NPEI_DMA_CONTROL[O_ADD1] = 0, the counter is updated by the total
00117                                                     bytes in the transfer.
00118                                                 When CA = 0, the hardware does not update any counters.
00119                                                 For an INBOUND or INTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfer, CA must never be
00120                                                 set, and the hardware never adds to the counters. */
00121         uint64_t fi:1;          /**< FI � Force interrupt.
00122                                                 When FI is set for an OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY transfer, the hardware
00123                                                 sets a forced interrupt bit after it completes the PCI DMA Instruction. If C = 0,
00124                                                 NPEI_INT_SUMn[DMA0_FI] is set, else NPEI_INT_SUMn[DMA1_FI] is set. For
00125                                                 an INBOUND or INTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA operation, FI must never be set,
00126                                                 and the hardware never generates interrupts. */
00127         uint64_t ii:1;          /**< II� Ignore the I bit (i.e. the I bit of the PCI DMA instruction local pointer).
00128                                                 For OUTBOUND transfers when II = 1, ignore the I bit and the FL bit in the
00129                                                 DMA HDR alone determines whether the hardware frees any/all of the local
00130                                                 buffers in the FIRST POINTERS area:
00131                                                     - when FL = 1, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=1.
00132                                                     - when FL = 0, the hardware does not free the local buffer when II=1.
00133                                                 For OUTBOUND transfers when II = 0, the I bit in the local pointer selects
00134                                                 whether local buffers are freed on a pointer-by-pointer basis:
00135                                                     - when (FL  I) is true, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=0.
00136                                                 For INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY, and EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfers,
00137                                                 II must never be set, and local buffers are never freed. */
00138         uint64_t fl:1;          /**< FL � Free local buffer.
00139                                                 When FL = 1, for an OUTBOUND operation, it indicates that the local buffers in
00140                                                 the FIRST BUFFERS area should be freed.
00141                                                 If II = 1, the FL bit alone indicates whether the local buffer should be freed:
00142                                                     - when FL = 1, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=1.
00143                                                     - when FL = 0, the hardware does not free the local buffer when II=1.
00144                                                 If II = 0, the I bit in the local pointer (refer to Section 9.5.2) determines whether
00145                                                 the local buffer is freed:
00146                                                     - when (FL  I) is true, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=0.
00147                                                 For an INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY, or EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfer,
00148                                                 FL must never be set, and local buffers are never freed. */
00149         uint64_t nlst:4;        /**< NLST � Number Last pointers.
00150                                                 The number of pointers in the LAST POINTERS area.
00151                                                 In the INBOUND, OUTBOUND, and EXTERNAL-ONLY cases, the LAST
00152                                                 POINTERS area contains PCI components, and the number of 64-bit words
00153                                                 required in the LAST POINTERS area is:
00154                                                     - HDR.NLST + ((HDR.NLST + 3)/4) where the division removes the fraction.
00155                                                 In the INTERNAL-ONLY case, the LAST POINTERS area contains local
00156                                                 pointers, and the number of 64-bit words required in the LAST POINTERS area is:
00157                                                     - HDR.NLST
00158                                                 Note that the sum of the number of 64-bit words in the LAST POINTERS and
00159                                                 FIRST POINTERS area must never exceed 31. */
00160         uint64_t nfst:4;        /**< NFST � Number First pointers.
00161                                                 The number of pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area.
00162                                                 In the INBOUND, OUTBOUND, and INTERNAL-ONLY cases, the FIRST
00163                                                 POINTERS area contains local pointers, and the number of 64-bit words required
00164                                                 in the FIRST POINTERS area is:
00165                                                     - HDR.NFST
00166                                                 In the EXTERNAL-ONLY case, the FIRST POINTERS area contains PCI
00167                                                 components, and the number of 64-bit words required in the FIRST POINTERS
00168                                                 area is:
00169                                                     - HDR.NFST + ((HDR.NFST + 3)/4) where the division removes the fraction. */
00170         uint64_t addr:40;       /**< PTR � Pointer, either a work-queue-entry pointer (when WQP = 1) or a local
00171                                                 memory pointer (WQP = 0).
00172                                                 When WQP = 1 and PTR  0x0, the hardware inserts the work-queue entry
00173                                                 indicated by PTR into a POW input queue after the PCI DMA operation is
00174                                                 complete. (Section 5.4 describes the work queue entry requirements in this
00175                                                 case.) When WQP = 1, PTR<2:0> must be 0x0.
00176                                                 When WQP = 0 and PTR  0x0, the hardware writes the single byte in local
00177                                                 memory indicated by PTR to 0x0 after the PCI DMA operation is complete.
00178                                                 NPEI_DMA_CONTROL[B0_LEND] selects the endian-ness of PTR in this
00179                                                 case.
00180                                                 When PTR = 0x0, the hardware performs no operation after the PCI DMA
00181                                                 operation is complete. */
00182     } cn38xx;
00183     struct {
00184         uint64_t reserved_62_63:2;
00185                         /**< Must be zero */
00186         uint64_t lport:2;       /**< Last port. LPort indicates the physical MAC port used for the
00187                                                 MAC memory space pointers in the LAST POINTERS block in the
00188                                                 OUTBOUND, INBOUND, and EXTERNAL-ONLY cases. Must be zero in the
00189                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY case. */
00190         uint64_t reserved_58_59:2;
00191         uint64_t fport:2;       /**< First port. FPort indicates the physical MAC port used for the
00192                                                 MAC memory space pointers in the FIRST POINTERS block in the
00193                                                 EXTERNAL-ONLY case. Must be zero in the OUTBOUND, INBOUND and
00194                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY cases. Must be zero on chips with PCI */
00195         uint64_t reserved_54_55:2;
00196         cvmx_dma_engine_transfer_t type:2;
00197                           /**< Type � A given DMA transfer is either OUTBOUND (read from L2/DRAM,
00198                                                 write into MAC memory space), INBOUND (read from MAC memory space, write
00199                                                 into L2/DRAM), INTERNAL-ONLY (read from L2/DRAM, write into L2/DRAM), or
00200                                                 EXTERNAL-ONLY (read from PCIe memory space, write into PCIe memory space). */
00201         uint64_t csel:1;          /**< CSEL � Counter. 1 = use counter 1, 0 = use counter 0.
00202                                                 The CSEL bit selects between the two counters (SLI_DMA(0..1)_CNT[CNT])
00203                                                 that DPI can optionally be updated after an OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY
00204                                                 transfer, and also selects between the two forced-interrupt bits
00205                                                 (SLI_DMA(0..1)_CNT[CNT] that can optionally be set after an
00206                                                 OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY transfer. C must be zero for INBOUND or
00207                                                 INTERNAL-ONLY transfers. */
00208         uint64_t ca:1;          /**< CA � Counter add.
00209                                                 When CA = 1, DPI updated the selected counter after it completed the
00210                                                 DMA OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY Instruction.
00211                                                     - If C = 0, DPI updated SLI_DMA0_CNT[CNT]
00212                                                     - If C = 1, DPI updated SLI_DMA1_CNT[CNT]
00213                                                 Note that this update may indirectly cause
00214                                                 SLI_INT_SUM[DCNT,DTIME] to become set (depending
00215                                                 on the SLI_DMA(0..1)_INT_LEVEL settings), so may cause
00216                         interrupts to occur on a remote MAC host.
00217                                                     - If DPI_DMA_CONTROL[O_ADD1] = 1, the counter is updated by 1.
00218                                                     - If DPI_DMA_CONTROL[O_ADD1] = 0, the counter is updated by the total
00219                                                     bytes in the transfer.
00220                                                 When CA = 0, DPI does not update any counters.
00221                                                 For an INBOUND or INTERNAL-ONLY DMA transfer, CA must never be
00222                                                 set, and DPI never adds to the counters. */
00223         uint64_t fi:1;          /**< FI � Force interrupt.
00224                                                 When FI is set for an OUTBOUND or EXTERNAL-ONLY transfer, the hardware
00225                                                 sets a forced interrupt bit after it completes the PCI DMA Instruction. If C = 0,
00226                                                 SLI_INT_SUM[DMAFI] is set, else SLI_INT_SUMn[DMA1FI] is set. For
00227                                                 an INBOUND or INTERNAL-ONLY DMA operation, FI must never be set,
00228                                                 and DPI never generates interrupts. */
00229         uint64_t ii:1;          /**< II� Ignore the I bit (i.e. the I bit of the DPI DMA instruction local pointer).
00230                                                 For OUTBOUND transfers when II = 1, ignore the I bit and the FL bit in the
00231                                                 DMA HDR alone determines whether the hardware frees any/all of the local
00232                                                 buffers in the FIRST POINTERS area:
00233                                                     - when FL = 1, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=1.
00234                                                     - when FL = 0, the hardware does not free the local buffer when II=1.
00235                                                 For OUTBOUND transfers when II = 0, the I bit in the local pointer selects
00236                                                 whether local buffers are freed on a pointer-by-pointer basis:
00237                                                     - when (FL  I) is true, the hardware frees the local buffer when II=0.
00238                                                 For INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY, and EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfers,
00239                                                 II must never be set, and local buffers are never freed. */
00240         uint64_t fl:1;          /**< FL � Free local buffer.
00241                                                 When FL = 1, for an OUTBOUND operation, it indicates that the local buffers in
00242                                                 the FIRST BUFFERS area should be freed.
00243                                                 If II = 1, the FL bit alone indicates whether the local buffer should be freed:
00244                                                     - when FL = 1, DPI frees the local buffer when II=1.
00245                                                     - when FL = 0, DPI does not free the local buffer when II=1.
00246                                                 If II = 0, the I bit in the local pointer (refer to Section 9.5.2) determines whether
00247                                                 the local buffer is freed:
00248                                                     - when (FL  I) is true, DPI frees the local buffer when II=0.
00249                                                 For an INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY, or EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfer,
00250                                                 FL must never be set, and local buffers are never freed. */
00251         uint64_t reserved_46:1;
00252         uint64_t pt:2;          /**< PT � Pointer Type.
00253                         - 0 = PTR<41:0> is byte address for ZBW with cache allocate.
00254                         - 1 = PTR<41:0> is byte address for ZBW with no cache allocate.
00255                         - 2 = PTR<41:0> is QW address for SSO PTR
00256                         - 3 = PTR<5:0> is CNT(0..47) to increment */
00257         uint64_t dealloce:1;        /**< DEALLOCE � Deallocation value enable. When set, use the
00258                         DEALLOCV to decrement the aura count on the instructions final pointer return. */
00259         uint64_t reserved_48:1;     /**< Must be zero */
00260         uint64_t nlst:4;        /**< NLST � Number Last pointers.
00261                                                 The number of pointers in the LAST POINTERS area.
00262                                                 In the INBOUND, OUTBOUND, and EXTERNAL-ONLY cases, the LAST
00263                                                 POINTERS area contains DPI components, and the number of 64-bit words
00264                                                 required in the LAST POINTERS area is:
00265                                                     - HDR.NLST + ((HDR.NLST + 3)/4) where the division removes the fraction.
00266                                                 In the INTERNAL-ONLY case, the LAST POINTERS area contains local
00267                                                 pointers, and the number of 64-bit words required in the LAST POINTERS area is:
00268                                                     - HDR.NLST
00269                                                 Note that the sum of the number of 64-bit words in the LAST POINTERS and
00270                                                 FIRST POINTERS area must never exceed 31. */
00271         uint64_t reserved_36_37:2;
00272         uint64_t nfst:4;        /**< NFST � Number First pointers.
00273                                                 The number of pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area.
00274                                                 In the INBOUND, OUTBOUND, and INTERNAL-ONLY cases, the FIRST
00275                                                 POINTERS area contains local pointers, and the number of 64-bit words required
00276                                                 in the FIRST POINTERS area is:
00277                                                     - HDR.NFST
00278                                                 In the EXTERNAL-ONLY case, the FIRST POINTERS area contains PCI
00279                                                 components, and the number of 64-bit words required in the FIRST POINTERS
00280                                                 area is:
00281                                                     - HDR.NFST + ((HDR.NFST + 3)/4) where the division removes the fraction. */
00282         uint64_t pvfe:1;            /**< Function Enable. */
00283         uint64_t reserved_28_30:3;
00284         uint64_t grp:10;        /**< GRP � Group. */
00285         uint64_t tt:2;          /**< TT � SSO Tag Type. Sent to SSO upon instruction completion if
00286                         PT == DPI_HDR_PT_WQP. */
00287         uint64_t reserved_12_15:4;
00288         uint64_t aura:12;       /**< AURA � Aura to free to, including FPA node number. */
00289     } cn78xx;
00290 } cvmx_dma_engine_header_word0_t;
00291 
00292 
00293 typedef union {
00294     uint64_t u64;
00295     struct {
00296         uint64_t deallocv:16;       /**< DEALLOCV � Deallocation value to decrement the aura count
00297                         on the instruction's final pointer return. */
00298         uint64_t reserved_42_47:6;
00299         uint64_t ptr:42;        /**< PTR � Pointer, 
00300                                                 When PT = 2 and PTR != 0x0, DPI inserts the work-queue entry
00301                                                 indicated by PTR into a SSO input queue after the DMA operation is
00302                                                 complete. (Section 5.4 describes the work queue entry requirements in this
00303                                                 case.) When WQP = 1, PTR<2:0> must be 0x0.
00304                                                 When PT = 0 and PTR != 0x0, DPI writes the single byte in local
00305                                                 memory indicated by PTR to 0x0 after the DMA operation is complete.
00306                                                 NPI_DMA_CONTROL[B0_LEND] selects the endian-ness of PTR in this
00307                                                 case.
00308                                                 When PT = 3 and PTR != 0x0, PTR < 48, DPI increments the
00309                         DPI_DMA_PPn_CNT[CNT], where the value for core n is PTR<5:0>-1.
00310                                                 When PTR = 0x0, DPI performs no operation after the DMA
00311                                                 operation is complete. */
00312     } s;
00313 } cvmx_dma_engine_header_word1_t;
00314 
00315 typedef struct cvmx_dma_engine_header {
00316     cvmx_dma_engine_header_word0_t word0;
00317     cvmx_dma_engine_header_word1_t word1;
00318 } cvmx_dma_engine_header_t;
00319 
00320 typedef union {
00321     uint64_t u64;
00322     struct {
00323         uint64_t i:1;           /**< I � Invert free.
00324                                                 This bit gives the software the ability to free buffers independently for an
00325                                                 OUTBOUND PCI DMA transfer. I is not used by the hardware when II is set. I
00326                                                 must not be set, and buffers are never freed, for INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY,
00327                                                 and EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfers. */
00328         uint64_t back:4;        /**< Back � Backup amount.
00329                                                 Allows the start of a buffer that is to be freed during an OUTBOUND transfer to
00330                                                 be different from the ptr value. Back specifies the amount to subtract from the
00331                                                 pointer to reach the start when freeing a buffer.
00332                                                 The address that is the start of the buffer being freed is:
00333                                                     - Buffer start address = ((ptr >> 7) - Back) << 7.
00334                                                 Back is only used by the hardware when the buffer corresponding to ptr is freed.
00335                                                 Back must be 0x0, and buffers are never freed, for INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY,
00336                                                 and EXTERNAL-ONLY PCI DMA transfers. */
00337         uint64_t pool:3;        /**< Pool � Free pool.
00338                                                 Specifies which pool (of the eight hardware-managed FPA free pools) receives the
00339                                                 buffer associated with ptr when freed during an OUTBOUND transfer.
00340                                                 Pool is only used when the buffer corresponding to ptr is freed. Pool must be 0x0,
00341                                                 and buffers are never freed, for INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY, and EXTERNAL-ONLY
00342                                                 PCI DMA transfers. */
00343         uint64_t f:1;           /**< F � Full-block writes are allowed.
00344                                                 When set, the hardware is permitted to write all the bytes in the cache blocks
00345                                                 covered by ptr, ptr + Size - 1. This can improve memory system performance
00346                                                 when the write misses in the L2 cache.
00347                                                 F can only be set for local pointers that can be written to:
00348                                                     - The local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area that are write pointers for
00349                                                     INBOUND transfers.
00350                                                     - The local pointers in the LAST POINTERS area that are always write
00351                                                     pointers (when present for INTERNAL-ONLY transfers).
00352                                                 F must not be set for local pointers that are not written to:
00353                                                     - The local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area for OUTBOUND and
00354                                                     INTERNAL-ONLY transfers. */
00355         uint64_t a:1;           /**< A � Allocate L2.
00356                                                 This is a hint to the hardware that the cache blocks should be allocated in the L2
00357                                                 cache (if they were not already). */
00358         uint64_t l:1;           /**< L � Little-endian.
00359                                                 When L is set, the data at ptr is in little-endian format rather than big-endian. */
00360         uint64_t size:13;       /**< Size � Size in bytes of the contiguous space specified by ptr. A Size value of 0 is
00361                                                 illegal. Note that the sum of the sizes in the FIRST POINTERS area must always
00362                                                 exactly equal the sum of the sizes/lengths in the LAST POINTERS area:
00363                                                     - In the OUTBOUND and INBOUND cases, the HDR.NFST size fields in the
00364                                                     local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area must exactly equal the lengths
00365                                                     of the HDR.NLST fragments in the PCI components in the LAST POINTERS
00366                                                     area.
00367                                                     - In the INTERNAL-ONLY case, the HDR.NFST size fields in the local
00368                                                     pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area must equal the HDR.NLST size
00369                                                     fields in the local pointers in the LAST POINTERS area. */
00370         uint64_t reserved_36_39:4;
00371                         /**< Must be zero */
00372         uint64_t addr:36;       /**< L2/DRAM byte pointer. Points to where the packet data starts.
00373                                                 Ptr can be any byte alignment. Note that ptr is interpreted as a big-endian byte
00374                                                 pointer when L is clear, a little-endian byte pointer when L is set. */
00375     } internal;
00376     struct {
00377         uint64_t i:1;           /**< I � Invert free.
00378                                                 This bit gives the software the ability to free buffers independently for an
00379                                                 OUTBOUND DMA transfer. I is not used by DPI when II is set. I
00380                                                 must not be set, and buffers are never freed, for INBOUND, INTERNAL-ONLY,
00381                                                 and EXTERNAL-ONLY DMA transfers. */
00382         uint64_t f:1;           /**< F � Full-block writes are allowed.
00383                                                 When set, the hardware is permitted to write all the bytes in the cache blocks
00384                                                 covered by ptr, ptr + Size - 1. This can improve memory system performance
00385                                                 when the write misses in the L2 cache.
00386                                                 F can only be set for local pointers that can be written to:
00387                                                     - The local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area that are write pointers for
00388                                                     INBOUND transfers.
00389                                                     - The local pointers in the LAST POINTERS area that are always write
00390                                                     pointers (when present for INTERNAL-ONLY transfers).
00391                                                 F must not be set for local pointers that are not written to:
00392                                                     - The local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area for OUTBOUND and
00393                                                     INTERNAL-ONLY transfers. */
00394         uint64_t ac:1;          /**< AC � Allocate L2.
00395                                                 This is a hint to DPI that the cache blocks should be allocated in the L2
00396                                                 cache (if they were not already). */
00397         uint64_t size:13;       /**< Size � Size in bytes of the contiguous space specified by ptr. A Size value of 0 is
00398                                                 illegal. Note that the sum of the sizes in the FIRST POINTERS area must always
00399                                                 exactly equal the sum of the sizes/lengths in the LAST POINTERS area:
00400                                                     - In the OUTBOUND and INBOUND cases, the HDR.NFST size fields in the
00401                                                     local pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area must exactly equal the lengths
00402                                                     of the HDR.NLST fragments in the PCI components in the LAST POINTERS
00403                                                     area.
00404                                                     - In the INTERNAL-ONLY case, the HDR.NFST size fields in the local
00405                                                     pointers in the FIRST POINTERS area must equal the HDR.NLST size
00406                                                     fields in the local pointers in the LAST POINTERS area. */
00407         uint64_t l:1;           /**< L � Little-endian.
00408                                                 When L is set, the data at ptr is in little-endian format rather than big-endian. */
00409         uint64_t reserved_42_46:5;
00410         uint64_t addr:42;       /**< L2/DRAM byte pointer. Points to where the packet data starts.
00411                                                 Ptr can be any byte alignment. Note that ptr is interpreted as a big-endian byte
00412                                                 pointer when L is clear, a little-endian byte pointer when L is set. */
00413     } internal_cn78xx;
00414     struct {
00415         uint64_t len0:16;       /**< Length of PCI / PCIe memory for address 0 */
00416         uint64_t len1:16;       /**< Length of PCI / PCIe memory for address 1 */
00417         uint64_t len2:16;       /**< Length of PCI / PCIe memory for address 2 */
00418         uint64_t len3:16;       /**< Length of PCI / PCIe memory for address 3 */
00419     } pcie_length;
00420 } cvmx_dma_engine_buffer_t;
00421 
00422 /**
00423   * Internal data structure to hold dma related configuration
00424   * (Only FPA configuration for now)
00425   */
00426 typedef struct
00427 {
00428     cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t command_queue_pool;
00429 } cvmx_dma_config_t;
00430 
00431 extern CVMX_SHARED cvmx_dma_config_t dma_config;
00432 
00433 /**
00434   * Gets the pool used by dma engine comamnd queue
00435   */
00436 static inline int64_t cvmx_fpa_get_dma_pool(void)
00437 {
00438     return (dma_config.command_queue_pool.pool_num);
00439 }
00440 
00441 /**
00442   * Gets the block size of buffer in command queue
00443   */
00444 static inline uint64_t cvmx_fpa_get_dma_pool_block_size(void)
00445 {
00446     return (dma_config.command_queue_pool.buffer_size);
00447 }

00454  */
00455 void cvmx_dma_set_cmd_que_pool_config(int64_t pool, uint64_t buffer_size,
00456                  uint64_t buffer_count);

00462 void cvmx_dma_get_cmd_que_pool_config(cvmx_fpa_pool_config_t* cmd_que_pool_cfg);

00473  * function is called.

00475  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure

00484 int cvmx_dma_engine_get_num(void);

00486 /**
00487  * Submit a series of DMA command to the DMA engines.
00488  *
00489  * @param engine  Engine to submit to (0 to cvmx_dma_engine_get_num()-1)
00490  * @param header  Command header
00491  * @param num_buffers
00492  *                The number of data pointers
00493  * @param buffers Command data pointers
00494  *
00495  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00496  */
00497 int cvmx_dma_engine_submit(int engine, cvmx_dma_engine_header_t header, int num_buffers, cvmx_dma_engine_buffer_t buffers[]);
00498 
00499 /**
00500  * Build the first and last pointers based on a DMA engine header
00501  * and submit them to the engine. The purpose of this function is
00502  * to simplify the building of DMA engine commands by automatically
00503  * converting a simple address and size into the apropriate internal
00504  * or PCI / PCIe address list. This function does not support gather lists,
00505  * so you will need to build your own lists in that case.
00506  *
00507  * @param engine Engine to submit to (0 to cvmx_dma_engine_get_num()-1)
00508  * @param header DMA Command header. Note that the nfst and nlst fields do not
00509  *               need to be filled in. All other fields must be set properly.
00510  * @param first_address
00511  *               Address to use for the first pointers. In the case of INTERNAL,
00512  *               INBOUND, and OUTBOUND this is an Octeon memory address. In the
00513  *               case of EXTERNAL, this is the source PCI / PCIe address.
00514  * @param last_address
00515  *               Address to use for the last pointers. In the case of EXTERNAL,
00516  *               INBOUND, and OUTBOUND this is a PCI / PCIe address. In the
00517  *               case of INTERNAL, this is the Octeon memory destination address.
00518  * @param size   Size of the transfer to perform.
00519  *
00520  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00521  */
00522 int cvmx_dma_engine_transfer(int engine, cvmx_dma_engine_header_t header, uint64_t first_address, uint64_t last_address, int size);
00523 
00524 /**
00525  * Simplified interface to the DMA engines to emulate memcpy()
00526  *
00527  * @param engine Engine to submit to (0 to cvmx_dma_engine_get_num()-1)
00528  * @param dest   Pointer to the destination memory. cvmx_ptr_to_phys() will be
00529  *               used to turn this into a physical address. It cannot be a local
00530  *               or CVMX_SHARED block.
00531  * @param source Pointer to the source memory.
00532  *               cvmx_ptr_to_phys() will be used to turn this
00533  *               into a physical address. It cannot be a local
00534  *               or CVMX_SHARED block.
00535  * @param length Number of bytes to copy
00536  *
00537  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00538  */
00539 static inline int cvmx_dma_engine_memcpy(int engine, void *dest, void *source, int length)
00540 {
00541     cvmx_dma_engine_header_t header;
00542     header.word0.u64 = 0;
00543     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
00544         header.word1.u64 = 0;
00545         header.word0.cn78xx.type = CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INTERNAL;
00546         header.word0.cn78xx.aura = cvmx_fpa_get_dma_pool(); /* FIXME: get aura from resources */
00547     } else
00548         header.word0.cn38xx.type = CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INTERNAL;
00549     return cvmx_dma_engine_transfer(engine, header, cvmx_ptr_to_phys(source), cvmx_ptr_to_phys(dest), length);
00550 }
00551 
00552 /**
00553  * Simplified interface to the DMA engines to emulate memcpy()
00554  * When dici_mode is enabled, send zero byte.
00555  *
00556  * @param engine Engine to submit to (0 to cvmx_dma_engine_get_num()-1)
00557  * @param dest   Pointer to the destination memory. cvmx_ptr_to_phys() will be
00558  *               used to turn this into a physical address. It cannot be a local
00559  *               or CVMX_SHARED block.
00560  * @param source Pointer to the source memory.
00561  *               cvmx_ptr_to_phys() will be used to turn this
00562  *               into a physical address. It cannot be a local
00563  *               or CVMX_SHARED block.
00564  * @param length Number of bytes to copy
00565  * @param core   core number for zero byte write
00566  *
00567  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00568  */ static inline int cvmx_dma_engine_memcpy_zero_byte(int engine, void *dest, void *source, int length, int core)
00569 {
00570     cvmx_dma_engine_header_t header;
00571     header.word0.u64 = 0;
00572     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_CN78XX_WQE)) {
00573         header.word1.u64 = 0;
00574         header.word0.cn78xx.type = CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INTERNAL;
00575     } else
00576         header.word0.cn38xx.type = CVMX_DMA_ENGINE_TRANSFER_INTERNAL;
00577     /* If dici_mode is set, DPI increments the DPI_DMA_PPn_CNT[CNT], where the
00578        value of core n is PTR<5:0>-1 when WQP=0 and PTR != 0 && PTR < 64. */
00579     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_DICI_MODE)) {
00580         cvmx_dpi_dma_control_t dma_control;
00581         dma_control.u64 = cvmx_read_csr(CVMX_DPI_DMA_CONTROL);
00582         if (dma_control.s.dici_mode) {
00583             header.word0.cn38xx.wqp = 0;    // local memory pointer
00584             header.word0.cn38xx.addr = core + 1;
00585         }
00586     }
00587     return cvmx_dma_engine_transfer(engine, header, cvmx_ptr_to_phys(source), cvmx_ptr_to_phys(dest), length);
00588 }
